children.text: There is a nogging that has been completely cut away, and is now effectively useless.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 1684 Residential Timber-Framed Construction, clause 6.2.1.5 Noggings states that

‘Unless otherwise specified, the minimum nogging size shall be the depth of the stud minus 25 mm by 25mm thick, or the nogging shall have a minimum cross-section of 50 mm × 38 mm for unseasoned timber and 42 mm × 35 mm for seasoned timber, and shall be suitable, where required, for the proper fixing of cladding, linings, and bracing’ .
This nogging will need to be replaced.
